contentrichtext.text: {{see also|Ken May}} '''Kenneth O. May''' (July 8, 1915, [[Portland, Oregon]] – December 1977, [[Toronto]]) was an [[United States|American]] [[mathematics|mathematician]] and [[historian of mathematics]], who developed [[May's theorem]]. The [[Kenneth O. May Prize]] is awarded for outstanding contributions to the history of mathematics. In 1966, May signed a vow of tax resistance to protest the Vietnam War.<ref>http://triptych.brynmawr.edu/cdm4/item_viewer.php?CISOROOT=%2FSC_Ephemera&CISOPTR=1585</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.unizar.es/ichm/may.html Obituary in Historia Mathematica 5 (1978), pp. 8–9] *[http://www.unizar.es/ichm/maymedal.html A Brief History of the Kenneth O. May Prize in the History of Mathematics] *[http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=3ZTedZtwYMoC&pg=PA172&dq=numeracy+++%22george+chandler%22&hl=en&ei=Bk_hTJbzMYqxhAfNop2lDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q&f=false Book in honour of May and his Prize] {{Authority control|VIAF=55566303}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = May, Kenneth | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American mathematician | DATE OF BIRTH = July 8, 1915 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = December 1977 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:May, Kenneth O}} [[Category:1915 births]] [[Category:1977 deaths]] [[Category:American mathematicians]] [[Category:American historians]] [[Category:American tax resisters]] [[Category:Historians of mathematics]] {{US-mathematician-stub}}
